programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: The Buffalo Bills' defense bent but didn't break in an outing initially dominated by Derrick Henry, who finished with 169 yards rushing and scored twice. Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen rallied his Bills for 16 points in last 4 minutes to stun the Baltimore Ravens 41-40 in a prime-time thriller.

programme.desc: The Buffalo Bills' defense bent but didn't break in an outing initially dominated by Derrick Henry, who finished with 169 yards rushing and scored twice. Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen rallied his Bills for 16 points in last 4 minutes to stun the Baltimore Ravens 41-40 in a prime-time thriller.

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 4
programme.desc: At the European Poker Tours 20th anniversary celebrations, theres a throwback vibe in the Main Event. A player calling himself The Eliminator is holding court at the feature table. Expect banter and bluffs, as this old school character competes for the 1.5m first prize. (4/11)

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 5
programme.desc: Survival is the name of the game, with just over 100 players remaining in the European Poker Tour Main Event. Most of the 9.5m prize pool is still up for grabs, and reigning champ Simon Wiciak and Monte-Carlo finalist Rania Nasreddine can both make EPT history. (5/11)

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 6
programme.desc: Theres 1.5m for the winner of this special anniversary edition of the European Poker Tour. As Day 4 of the Main Event continues, the USAs Rania Nasreddine is put through the wringer and a new generation of poker talent starts to make its mark. (6/11)

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 8
programme.desc: In the late stages of this European Poker Tour Main Event, mistakes are starting to creep in. But theres no margin for error, with millions still on the line. Among the final 23 are American pro Stephen Song and former EPT finalist Rania Nasreddine. (8/11)

Little did she know, that her holiday fling, would become a holiday thing.

programme.title: Fort Massacre
programme.desc: After his cavalry company is decimated by an Apache attack, Vinson (Joel McCrea) takes charge and tries to lead his remaining men to safety. The enlisted men, especially the rebellious McGurney (Forrest Tucker), question Vinson's leadership and even his morality, but the soldiers must stick together if they wish to make it through Apache lands.

Keeley forces them to help with his next planned heist: stealing gold from a wagon train led by Don Antonio Chaves. The men insinuate themselves with Chaves in preparation for the robbery, but when Will (Joel McCrea) falls in love with a widow (Arlene Dahl) traveling with Chaves, the three men must decide whether to continue the plan.

programme.title: Wichita
programme.desc: After a group of drunken trail riders runs amok, Mayor Andrew Hope (Carl Benton Reid) of Wichita, Kan., recruits the intrepid Wyatt Earp (Joel McCrea) to end lawlessness. Armed and ready for anything, the new marshal decides he will end gun violence simply by banning guns. Soon Earp must face crooked rancher Clint Wallace (Walter Sande) and whiskey slinger Doc Black (Edgar Buchanan), vicious locals who like Wichita exactly as it is and don't take kindly to being told what to do.

programme.title: The Moonlighter
programme.desc: Wes Anderson (Fred MacMurray) is caught cattle rustling and promptly jailed. The public is outraged, but, since Wes always worked at night, they don't know what he looks like. Still, they break into the prison and lynch a hobo they think is Wes, while the actual culprit sneaks off to see his old flame, Rela (Barbara Stanwyck), who has recently taken up with his straitlaced brother, Tom (William Ching). But Tom is envious of his outlaw brother, and he decides to join Wes in a life of crime.

programme.title: Trooper Hook
programme.desc: Wanted for killing a squadron of soldiers, Apache Chief Nanchez (Rudolfo Acosta) is finally captured by Sgt. Clovis Hook (Joel McCrea), who discovers among Nanchez's prisoners Cora Sutliff (Barbara Stanwyck), who had been missing for several years. Sutliff has not only fully integrated into the Apache way of life, she also has a son with Nanchez. Now Hook wants to transport her back to her old way of life, but Nanchez isn't willing to let his son be taken from him.

programme.title: Harland Williams: What a Treat
programme.desc: Stand-up comic Harland Williams takes centre stage at the El Rey Theatre in Los Angeles for a riotous evening of laughs; featured topics range from everyman observations on fingernails and fried food to musings on dating and the Pillsbury Doughboy.

programme.title: Craig Shoemaker: Daditude
programme.desc: The Emmy-winning stand-up, producer, writer, and author tickles funnybones as he recounts his bumpy transition from manhood to parenthood.

programme.title: Kevin Nealon: Whelmed, But Not Overly
programme.desc: With his unique sense of humor, profound dry wit, and likeable demeanor, Kevin Nealon brings his jazzy cool style to Whelmed But Not Overly. He's like a big kid as he delights in stories of messing with celebrities and embarrassing moments.

programme.title: Joel McHale: Live From Pyongyang
programme.desc: Fan favorite Joel McHale shines in his first stand-up special with jokes on being mistaken for Daniel Tosh, feeding alligators in the South, and more.

programme.title: Michael Yo: Blasian
programme.desc: Comedian Michael Yo taps into his experience growing up black and Asian in Texas to inform his takes on marriage, fatherhood, race and religion.

programme.title: Fred Klett: One of Ten
programme.desc: The comedian discusses growing up in a large Christian family, modern parenting, and the ridiculous nature of how todays kids are disciplined.

programme.title: Jinkx Monsoon: Red Head Redemption
programme.desc: Jinkx Monsoon recounts some of the crazier tales from her sex-addicted, alcoholic past, which led to her finding her true self.

programme.title: Jimmy O. Yang: Guess How Much?
programme.desc: Yang dives into love languages, loser friends and negotiating with his Asian parents.

programme.title: Jimmy O. Yang: Good Deal
programme.desc: The Silicon Valley star uses his debut stand-up special to discuss tall women, disappointing his parents, and how he learned English from rap videos.

programme.title: Gina Brillon: The Floor Is Lava
programme.desc: The stand up comic discusses her childhood, the secrets that men have learned about dating apps, and life with her Midwestern husband.

programme.title: Gina Yashere: Laughing to America
programme.desc: Live from San Francisco, UK's top black female comedian Gina Yashere brings her unique insider-outsider perspective on America's hottest news.

programme.title: Doug Benson: Doug Dynasty
programme.desc: The comic stoner performs his first comedy special at the Neptune Theatre in Seattle, where he responds to hurtful Tweets and does impressions.

programme.title: Bring Back Laughs
programme.desc: This live, socially-distant special filmed in a parking lot brings together an all-star lineup of beloved comedians to raise money for Direct Relief.

programme.title: Can't Stand It!
programme.desc: "Can't Stand It!" is a 2022 stand-up comedy special written and performed by comedians Rasheed Stephens, Tevin Scott, Ceasar Lizardo and Chris Gardner, and directed by Scooter Powell.

programme.title: Mike Birbiglia: My Girlfriend's Boyfriend
programme.desc: Comic Mike Birbiglia takes us on a painfully honest and hilariously entertaining journey through a lifetime of romantic bungles and missteps.

programme.title: Mike Birbiglia: What I Should Have Said Was Nothing
programme.desc: The comic performs.

programme.title: Brian Aylward: Big in Asia
programme.desc: The Canadian comic performs in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, where he uses his first stand-up comedy special to discuss his adventures in Asia.

programme.title: Margaret Cho: Psycho
programme.desc: The comic provocateur tackles a new list of taboosfrom race to sexuality to Boko Haramin front of a live audience at New Yorks Town Hall.

programme.title: Funny Women of a Certain Age
programme.desc: Fran Drescher leads a cast of mature women of stand-up in a night of uninhibited comedy; featuring Carole Montgomery, Luenell, Lynne Koplitz, Kerri Louise and Vanessa Hollingshead.

programme.title: More Funny Women of a Certain Age
programme.desc: Caroline Rhea headlines a cast of women for a night of uninhibited stand-up comedy; featuring Carol Leifer, Tammy Pescatelli, Thea Vidale, Carole Montgomery, and Julia Scotti.

programme.title: Even More Funny Women of a Certain Age
programme.desc: Golden Globe winner Teri Hatcher joins the stage with some of the funniest women in comedy for one night of over-the-top, uninhibited standup.

programme.title: KatieHughes: The Haunting of Hopscotch
programme.desc: The LA-based stand-up's stories of workplace terror and growing up in the South charm a crowd of diehard fans at Raleighs Hopscotch Music Festival.

programme.title: D.L. Hughley: Clear
programme.desc: Comedian D.L. Hughley comments on current political events and hot topics, from marijuana legalization to the advantages of intrusive white neighbors.

programme.title: D.L. Hughley: Reset
programme.desc: Notable standup comedian D.L. Hughley skewers current political events, his own family issues, and more in this hilarious standup special.

programme.title: Anjelah Johnson: Mahalo & Goodnight
programme.desc: In her fourth stand-up comedy special, Anjelah Johnson dishes on awkward massages, home invasions, spiders, and being a full-grown child.

programme.title: Anjelah Johnson: The Homecoming Show
programme.desc: The comic shares her stories of growing up with a sports enthusiast father who never wanted to pay for athletic training, and other hilarious tales.

programme.title: Jeff Allen: I Can Laugh About It Now
programme.desc: The comedian discusses his lifes difficulties including addiction, bankruptcy, and how to overcome tragedy by making lemonade out of lemons.

programme.title: Jeff Allen: Honor Thy Wife
programme.desc: The laugh-out-loud funny stand up comedian focuses his special on the hilarious highs and relatable lows of everyday married life.

programme.title: Arvin Mitchell: Circus Purpose
programme.desc: The comedian nails a series of impressions and hilarious stories, especially when talking about the life of his 107-year-old grandfather.

programme.title: Bill Hicks: Relentless

programme.desc: The comedian observes religion, evolution, childbirth and politics in London.

programme.title: Bill Hicks: Sane Man
programme.desc: Live comedy performed by Bill Hicks.

programme.title: Paul Rodriguez: The Here and Wow

programme.title: Tammy Pescatelli's Way After School Special

programme.desc: The hilarious and sometimes humiliating aspects of domestic life, including marriage and in-laws, are the focus of this comedy special.

programme.desc: Ben and Darlene are excited to share their good news with the family, but Neville and Jackie, and Aldo and Harris, share their own very similar news.

programme.desc: Problems arise on Beverly Rose's first day of kindergarten; Becky and Darlene have a disagreement.

programme.desc: Harris takes a stand on an issue that ruffles a few feathers in Darlene's new neighborhood.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Beams and Jets, Donut Swing, Big Balls, a Potato Sack, and Barrel Crossing are just some of the over-the-top obstacles included in this weeks episode.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: 20 ordinary Canadians will compete in the worlds largest most extreme obstacle course designed to provide the most spills, thrills and fantastic fumbles ever seen on television.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Log Roll, Wall Swing, The Ring, Tippy Tables, and Cylinder Run are among the over-the-top obstacles in this weeks episode.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Donut run, ball swing. Sweeper: Dangly balls. Dizzy Dummy: barrel crossing and log roll

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, contestants face different games like Dizzy Dummies and The Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: The Almost Impossible Gameshow
programme.desc: Another episode of the game show in which 50 members of the public compete - with almost no chance of winning.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Dirty Balls, The Donut Swing, The Toothbrush Bristles, Tippy Tables and Dock Maze are among some of the over-the-top obstacles included in this weeks episode.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Wipeout Canada brings you a countdown of the season's most memorable moments with never-before-seen footage, extended scenes and live interviews with some of the most popular contestants.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In the first episode of season 3, Richard Hammond introduces a brand new challenge called Crash Mountain.

programme.title: Total Wipeout

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, contestants face different games like Dizzy Dummies and The Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns dont come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of violent love, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the last episode of the season and the 8 previous winners compete to be the Champion of Champions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don welcomes us to his garden at Longmeadow and offers some tips on keeping our gardens at their best throughout the season. Carol Klein meets wildlife enthusiast Steve Head, to discover more about the wildlife that depend on our garden ponds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes a look at the use of pots and containers and revels in their versatility, practicality and potential and shows us how best to use them in our own gardens. Carol Klein returns to Stroud to see how the new gardeners are progressing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don will be cutting back his delphiniums and adding a touch of the exotic to his Jewel Garden. Carol Klein is in Kent meeting lavender expert and breeder, Dr Simon Charlesworth, whose stunning walled garden is packed with many varieties of this beautifully scented plant.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein is in Hampshire with the great horticulturist, Roy Lancaster, appreciating the virtues of the often overlooked St John's wort. Joe Swift is out and about too and visits a very unusual allotment in Tottenham, North London.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don's garden at Longmeadow is thriving in the summer sunshine and is looking more beautiful by the day, but the warm, wet weather has meant the hedges are growing like crazy and are in need of a good haircut.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has left Longmeadow this week to explore the beautiful gardens at RHS Hyde Hall in Essex. He seeks inspiration from their amazing dry garden and discovers how they manage to keep their lawns looking pristine in such a hot summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty turns his attention to his ornamental grass borders, Carol travels to Cheshire to view some heleniums, and Joe is treated to a Jamaican feast when he visits Moor Green Allotments in Birmingham.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: For many gardeners, the beginning of September is the start of a new season. Monty Don embraces this shift as he harvests an abundance of delicious produce, at the same time as looking ahead to the spring.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don adds some foxtail lilies to his dry garden, Carol Klein visits salvia expert William Dyson in Kent, and we meet a remarkable woman from a family of gardeners on the eve of her 100th birthday.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn gathers momentum, it's time to start putting the garden to bed for winter. Monty Don has some timely advice on what to do. Carol Klein meets a nurseryman in Herefordshire and together they indulge in the beauty of the Japanese maple.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles the perennial problem of what to grow in the shade beneath a tree, Carol Klein takes a look at the crocosmia and we meet a gardener in Derbyshire who has spent a lifetime growing and showing gladioli.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A celebration of people who are growing their own, from vegetables to flowers, across the UK. At Longmeadow, Monty shares tips and advice on how to get the most out of bargain plants. Meanwhile, Joe visits an extraordinary food project in Bristol.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gets going with some autumn garden maintenance whilst looking back over the year and reviewing his borders - which plants have done well and others that haven't. As he clears annuals that are past their best he plans a colourful display for late spring by planting up the garden with tulips. Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage continuing work on her new raised beds and taming an overgrown and unruly rambling rose.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's dividing his Pulmonaria and gives advice on frost-protection, Joe visits a tropical oasis outside Bristol, and Carol looks at Rowans from around the world.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the arrival of October, it is time to start thinking about getting some onions and garlic in the ground, and Monty Don shares his secrets on how to get a successful crop. Elsewhere, Carol Klein takes first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for a day out in Devon. They are on the hunt for some seasonal inspiration for their new garden and what better place to look than RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for his spring display and tackles slippery paths, Carol Klein visits a collection of Michaelmas daisies and we visit a veg grower with a show-stopping Halloween pumpkin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares the flowering borders for winter and makes a bonfire, Carol celebrates our berry-laden hedgerows, and Rachel visits Julian Clary in his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol is looking at one of the gems of early spring; the crocus, Joe visits a bog garden in west Wales, and Rachel visits a fabulous rose garden with over 2500 different varieties.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol looks at the spring delight that is the cyclamen, Joe visits a gardener taking on the challenges of gardening on the windswept Cornish coastline, and Monty tackles the problem of box blight.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives his pond a spring clean, Carol helps a family in Gloucestershire with their first garden, and Joe visits a gardener in Northumberland who copes with extremes of temperature.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein admires the true harbinger of spring, the daffodil. Also, a visit to dahlia enthusiast Darren Everest on his allotment in Kent, and Monty Don pots up his dahlia tubers, and offers tips for getting the best results later in the year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is giving his ornamental grasses an overhaul. He's got tips on how to lift and divide ones that have grown too large. Meanwhile, Rachel visits the stunning Trebah Garden in Cornwall to revel in their glorious collection of hydrangeas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don finishes rejuvenating his dry garden, a sun baked corner of the garden that had become over-run by thuggish plants, and Carol Klein is in the rather exotic setting of Abbotsbury Subtropical Gardens in Dorset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has suggestions for beautiful climbers that thrive in shady spots and gets on with planting up his vegetable garden, while Carol Klein returns to help first time gardeners, Dan and Dominique.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein is with eminent plantsman Keith Wiley, at his garden in Devon, celebrating the exquisite dog's tooth violet. At Longmeadow, Monty Don cracks on with some timely tasks and makes a start on planting up a yew hedge.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is at home sharing his love of ornamental grasses, tackling the problem of building a patio on a slope and giving some inspiration on what to plant at the base of a wall. In Margate, the team visit a man who has come up with a unique way of using a shed roof to grow vegetables, and they travel to Swansea to meet inspirational gardener Sue Kent, who shows how she has designed her garden to enable her to garden successfully despite her upper limb difference.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty is planting bulbs in pots and around the garden for an explosion of spring colour. Carol Klein travels to Yorkshire where she takes a close look at the enormous colour range and form of a late season perennial, the salvia. Mark Lane is in Oxfordshire looking at how ornamental grasses can be used in planting design to create exciting combinations.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: A truck driver from Wakefield with a passion for flowers wants to create a perfect outside space for his girlfriend and burgeoning family, while in Swindon a widow wants to find the best way of turning her bleak patch of green into a cottage garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty travels to two corners of the country where the challenges he faces are very different. On the south coast he is presented with a front garden ravaged by salty winds, and in Snowdonia he helps a mountainside garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty helps two families create dream gardens that are as much for the children as for the adults. In Doncaster, Nikki and John want a garden full of edible plants and fruit.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels from the north west coast of Scotland to the north east coast of England, from historic reconstructions to modern re-inventions. He visits some of the most inhospitable places in the country and finds gardens that are flourishing.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across some of the country's landscapes, heading across the north of England to Northern Ireland. Here, Monty sees the ingenuity, passion and determination of British people to garden and create gardens, no matter what the canvas.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the middle of the country, from Wales to Norfolk. He comes across gardens for gnomes, much-loved, well-tended allotments and extravagant gardens that bankrupted their owners.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the most densely populated part of the country, London and the home counties. He visits some of London's gardens, including a special one on a barge, as well as a beautifully restored garden close to where he grew up in Hampshire.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the south west of the country to visit some of Britain's most exotic gardens. On this journey, Monty also goes to some of the country's most historic gardens, as well as some challenging contemporary ones.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is preparing for spring colour as well as harvesting pumpkins and squashes. Carol Klein visits comedian Joe Lycett at home, and together, they plant up a container packed with layers of colourful bulbs. Toby Buckland visits Sue Kent's garden near Swansea to help out with autumnal maintenance.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants for pollinators in the Wildlife Garden and trims his box topiary cones. He also takes succulent leaf cuttings and continues the summer veg harvest. Meanwhile, Carol Klein visits stunning Italian-influenced gardens in Gloucestershire.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for huntersand its been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, well celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with his friends at the National Wild Turkey Federation to dive into turkey conservation, and hunt the largest subspecies of wild turkey. Kyle finishes off this episode with his most favorite wild game recipe, boneless wild turkey wings.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: The Montana adventure continues on private lakes targeting trophy trout. This is where fish stories are born.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: From battling towering 12-foot waves in the Gulf of Alaska, to reeling in colossal 200 lb. halibut, they discover firsthand the rugged beauty of America's 49th state. This episode highlights Lindell Yachts as a top builder of rugged offshore sportfishing yachts, as well as Radon Boats as great pilothouse fishing and guide boats.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: "Hope you're hungry. In this episode, come along as we eat our weight in sushi and ramen, meet nori farmers and wagyu ranchers, and make some new surfing buddies along the way. P.S. if you're hungry for more Japan content, stay tuned for our next two episodes.In this episode of DIRT, the crew road tripped around Kyushu. The food culture in Kyushu dates back to the emperors of Japan, and the Black Current off the eastern shore has shaped the island's cuisine for centuries. The DIRT team followed that current up the coastline, surfing with new friends and tasting new flavors. And with each stop, we learned even more about how the traditions we keep can honor thousands of years of knowledgeand point the way to the future."

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: READY TO ROLL!!almostWe have our bus. We have our boat. And we have Mr. J. Rockfish on board to steer the ship. But before we can hit the road, weve got some work to do.The busit needs a new motor and maybe some other stuff (TBD) thats been hiding under 40 years of crust and crudThe boat, it needs some fiberglass work. A casting platform and floor would be coolmaybe a paint job.And Jay, well his gear is pretty shot, and his normally ripped physique has been obscured under some COVID poundage he acquired over the past year or soAnd maybe a pedicure and haircut are in order before stepping in front of the cameraFirst, the bus. A little interior decorating perhaps. The 14 seats built for preschoolers dont quite accommodate over-sized fishing dudes. And, come to find out, there are no rod racks. No bar. No stereo. No beds. No fly-tying stations. And no beer fridge. How did those kids survive?Time to gut this thingCheck it out! #fishingwithjay

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: With Tampa Bay suffering from a tragic red tide, Court left his home waters to fish with Jay and Casey in our backyard, the flats of Indian River and Mosquito Lagoon.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Capt Josh and Johnny from Johnny Jigs head out with gorgeous weather on their side to hit some reefs and put the jigs to work!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week our team visits the G2 Ranch along with life time TTHA member Owen West. Owen has been a member and volunteer for Texas Trophy Hunters for 46 years and was invited to share camp with us. It was a hunt he never dreamed would happen in his lifetime.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We find ourselves fishing with Troy from Lonestar Beer. Not only is Troy a great friend he is also a big supporter of Hunters Extravaganza. We get to catch up in the offseason and spend a day on the water discussing future events and reflect on what all Texas has to offer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed for the opportunity to follow along the guys from Trinity Oaks for Bucks for the Brave. The men and women that served in our armed services and as first responders, had jobs that required the, to be willing to sacrifice their own lives every day, in order to protect or save someone else's. Not many of us can say that, nor understand what that truly means. The things they've had to see, and the sacrifices they've made in their daily lives, can have a profound impact on them. Trinity Oaks' Bucks for the Brave platform allows the loved ones and communities that support these heroes to share their stories and unite us all in honoring and recognizing their service to our great nation. We are proud to continue to be a part of this incredible program, getting these heroes in the outdoors for the hunt of a lifetime.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. Thats where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredientsfrom sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintans kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float planea new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, the land of earth, sea, and sky. All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaskas abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. Therell be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for nowjoin usthere are halibut to filet, rainforest shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiters Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryans family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiters pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike and Chi Lui they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies for trolling and reef fishing. The team reels in a variety of fish, including snapper, mackerel, porgy, blue fish. Cabo Mike goes over the hook set ups they used and equipment tips. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryans passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with Ryan meeting up with Mandy & Hawkin to ice skate outside in Palm Beach County FL.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Witness a truly epic day on the water when Capt. Justin and Meredith find a secluded slice of beach teeming with redfish biting virtually everything. Topwater plugs, rusty flies and a live well full of bait make for an experience no redfish angler would forget

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When your gut tells you to do something different than whats in front of you, do you listen?Capt. Justin and Meredith listen, and find that success comes in many forms. And it turns out that success can be really tasty, too!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Its opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexicos most popular fish?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Theres nothing like a change in weather conditions to wreck a perfectly good fishing plan, and thats exactly what Capt. Justin Leake and his cousin encounter when December turns unseasonably warm. Its a grey morning with thick fog so Justin and Capt. Brent Berry wont be heading offshore right away as planned. Instead, Justin turns to his Humminbird CoastMaster charts to pinpoint a near shore artificial reef just five minutes from the St. Andrews Pass, where the anglers will do a little fishing until the fog burns off. Capt. Leake opts to send a jig to the bottom and hes not very picky about the one that gets tied on. When fishing reefs, the specific jig doesnt matter because its all about the presentation, he says. When youre sitting on top of a wreck, break out the junk jigs they get bit just fine. And that proves to be the case as Justin and Brent enjoy non-stop battles against amberjack, red snapper and bonita. And with a bite this good, theres no reason to go anywhere else! Also, we take a look at the United States Coast Guard Auxiliarys new paddle craft safety initiative.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team take a trip to Marine Surplus in order to gather miscellaneous parts for AquaSport project such as cleats, rod holders, and a rub rail getting them one step closer to finishing the project. The crew then heads back to the project were they get to work on installing the parts gathered and getting the AquaSport accessorized.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Witness a truly epic day on the water when Capt. Justin and Meredith find a secluded slice of beach teeming with redfish biting virtually everything. Topwater plugs, rusty flies and a live well full of bait make for an experience no redfish angler would forget

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When your gut tells you to do something different than whats in front of you, do you listen?Capt. Justin and Meredith listen, and find that success comes in many forms. And it turns out that success can be really tasty, too!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Its opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexicos most popular fish?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Theres nothing like a change in weather conditions to wreck a perfectly good fishing plan, and thats exactly what Capt. Justin Leake and his cousin encounter when December turns unseasonably warm. Its a grey morning with thick fog so Justin and Capt. Brent Berry wont be heading offshore right away as planned. Instead, Justin turns to his Humminbird CoastMaster charts to pinpoint a near shore artificial reef just five minutes from the St. Andrews Pass, where the anglers will do a little fishing until the fog burns off. Capt. Leake opts to send a jig to the bottom and hes not very picky about the one that gets tied on. When fishing reefs, the specific jig doesnt matter because its all about the presentation, he says. When youre sitting on top of a wreck, break out the junk jigs they get bit just fine. And that proves to be the case as Justin and Brent enjoy non-stop battles against amberjack, red snapper and bonita. And with a bite this good, theres no reason to go anywhere else! Also, we take a look at the United States Coast Guard Auxiliarys new paddle craft safety initiative.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: After several years of shifting focus back to his native whitetails, Dahlke returns to mule deer country with the Muley Freak, Erik Van Woerkom. Follow along on this Utah mule deer hunt.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest its about the journey.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Todd Rogers embraces the business of being a hunting outfitter as a labor of love. And while so many family-run operations are dwindling in rural America, the Rogers legacy is here to stay. Will Cooper and Josh Dahlke return to western Oklahoma to share this story while pursuing brush-country whitetails in the red dirt.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Ismael Garcia was just a young soldier when a tragic incident in Afghanistan changed his life forever. He was left wounded and scarred, but the hardest part came after he returned home. Hunting had always been his escape. But after war, everything felt different until he picked up a bow.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode we take you behind the scenes of production for one of the biggest and baddest listings Slade has ever gotten - Southside Land Company in Jefferson County, MS. Hunter Phelps comes down from Kentucky to help film, and Slade puts him on 2 Mississippi gobblers.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade shows us around some of his investment properties, and Ryan kills a nice bull elk in New Mexico.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man

programme.desc: Brandon takes outdoorsman Zac Yarbrough to look for blackfin tuna and then out deep for swordfish. They are joined by Styles Haury for some epic offshore action.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Renowned Kiteboarder Mike Walsh goes out on a windy day with Brandon to see what they can catch around the iconic lighthouses of the middle Keys.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Get to know one extraordinary person who works on the show as we go fishing with underwater cameraman and boat captain himself, Garrett Stephens.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Jared Dieguz has been fishing all his life and now that he's running his own charter business, finding a day to "scout" the sea is more important than ever.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: On a crisp Iowa November morning, everything comes together as Drake Lamb with Midwest Whitetail grunts in a massive 8-point buck that he encountered before with the WoodHaven Midwest Grunter. This is one hunt you dont want to miss!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten & Mark Scroggins is in Oklahoma during the peak rut, chasing mature whitetail bucks! With bucks on the move and searching for does, it's the perfect time to break out the calls. Watch as Mark and Colten pull out all the stopsgetting aggressively loud with the WoodHaven "Intimidator" Grunt Callto turn a cruising buck and bring him right into bow range at the blind.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: U.S. Marines combat correspondent Ken Plant tells of being captured and tortured as a POW.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Bow season is finally here and the boys are at the Dirty Bird in Oklahoma. Randy is chasing a buck he named "The Camp Buck" because of how close the buck is to camp. If Randy can get it done this will be his biggest buck to date in Oklahoma.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are wrapping things up on the Raven before bow season arrives in Missouri. Planting I-70 the plot where Randy killed one of his biggest Missouri bucks ever last year. Then Randy and Cody attempt to setup a new farm they are calling The River Farm they attempt to plant a food plot, bush hog, spray the plot, setup a new Titan blind, and setup a Hooyman dual perimeter fence all in one day before the sun goes down.

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: Massive wildfires had consumed thousands of acres across the Bighorn Mountains and the neighboring foothills. Would the annual HuntStand pronghorn camp be a total bust, or would the crew be able to find a few animals beyond the smoke?

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Dan Schmidt struggles with freezing Nebraska temperatures on a whitetail rut hunt in the Sandhills.

programme.title: Pure Hunting
programme.desc: Willi and Chris have hunted NM for years with some success each year. This year they include two new friends, Nick Ventura and his dad. They receive rain like they never had before and when they finally make it out to hunt, Willi is hoping to connect.

programme.title: Pure Hunting
programme.desc: Willi spends 8 days chasing a few bucks, but has sights set on High Beam. After a few encounters and one on his last morning, he hopes for last minute success on his last afternoon.

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: October is here. We start out in Nebraska, head to Kansas and end up in Georgia. Many people have been impacted by the recent hurricanes. To help those in need we are hunting does and will donate as much venison as we possibly can to the victims.

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan and Michael Pitts try to keep the new season streak going. Things get real in a hurry when Pitts encounter doesnt go as planned.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Greg Camp heads back to Nebraska for the third year in a row hoping to put his bow tag on a giant 10 Pointer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer seasons past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson closes out the half way point on the South America Waterfowl Slam. On just the third day of the hunt, he is able to take a Chilean Wigeon and a Rosy Billed Pochard which make species number 9 and 10 of the 20 on his list. Mark is still sharing the blind with Matt Gindorff, a WTA consultant, and they discuss waterfowl hunting in Argentina and how it compares to that of the U.S.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed for the opportunity to follow along the guys from Trinity Oaks for Bucks for the Brave. The men and women that served in our armed services and as first responders, had jobs that required the, to be willing to sacrifice their own lives every day, in order to protect or save someone else's. Not many of us can say that, nor understand what that truly means. The things they've had to see, and the sacrifices they've made in their daily lives, can have a profound impact on them. Trinity Oaks' Bucks for the Brave platform allows the loved ones and communities that support these heroes to share their stories and unite us all in honoring and recognizing their service to our great nation. We are proud to continue to be a part of this incredible program, getting these heroes in the outdoors for the hunt of a lifetime.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for huntersand its been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, well celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with his friends at the National Wild Turkey Federation to dive into turkey conservation, and hunt the largest subspecies of wild turkey. Kyle finishes off this episode with his most favorite wild game recipe, boneless wild turkey wings.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: The Montana adventure continues on private lakes targeting trophy trout. This is where fish stories are born.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: From battling towering 12-foot waves in the Gulf of Alaska, to reeling in colossal 200 lb. halibut, they discover firsthand the rugged beauty of America's 49th state. This episode highlights Lindell Yachts as a top builder of rugged offshore sportfishing yachts, as well as Radon Boats as great pilothouse fishing and guide boats.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: "Hope you're hungry. In this episode, come along as we eat our weight in sushi and ramen, meet nori farmers and wagyu ranchers, and make some new surfing buddies along the way. P.S. if you're hungry for more Japan content, stay tuned for our next two episodes.In this episode of DIRT, the crew road tripped around Kyushu. The food culture in Kyushu dates back to the emperors of Japan, and the Black Current off the eastern shore has shaped the island's cuisine for centuries. The DIRT team followed that current up the coastline, surfing with new friends and tasting new flavors. And with each stop, we learned even more about how the traditions we keep can honor thousands of years of knowledgeand point the way to the future."

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: READY TO ROLL!!almostWe have our bus. We have our boat. And we have Mr. J. Rockfish on board to steer the ship. But before we can hit the road, weve got some work to do.The busit needs a new motor and maybe some other stuff (TBD) thats been hiding under 40 years of crust and crudThe boat, it needs some fiberglass work. A casting platform and floor would be coolmaybe a paint job.And Jay, well his gear is pretty shot, and his normally ripped physique has been obscured under some COVID poundage he acquired over the past year or soAnd maybe a pedicure and haircut are in order before stepping in front of the cameraFirst, the bus. A little interior decorating perhaps. The 14 seats built for preschoolers dont quite accommodate over-sized fishing dudes. And, come to find out, there are no rod racks. No bar. No stereo. No beds. No fly-tying stations. And no beer fridge. How did those kids survive?Time to gut this thingCheck it out! #fishingwithjay

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: With Tampa Bay suffering from a tragic red tide, Court left his home waters to fish with Jay and Casey in our backyard, the flats of Indian River and Mosquito Lagoon.

programme.desc: Capt Josh and Johnny from Johnny Jigs head out with gorgeous weather on their side to hit some reefs and put the jigs to work!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. Thats where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredientsfrom sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintans kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float planea new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, the land of earth, sea, and sky. All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaskas abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. Therell be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for nowjoin usthere are halibut to filet, rainforest shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiters Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryans family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiters pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike and Chi Lui they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies for trolling and reef fishing. The team reels in a variety of fish, including snapper, mackerel, porgy, blue fish. Cabo Mike goes over the hook set ups they used and equipment tips. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryans passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with Ryan meeting up with Mandy & Hawkin to ice skate outside in Palm Beach County FL.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When your gut tells you to do something different than whats in front of you, do you listen?Capt. Justin and Meredith listen, and find that success comes in many forms. And it turns out that success can be really tasty, too!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Its opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexicos most popular fish?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Theres nothing like a change in weather conditions to wreck a perfectly good fishing plan, and thats exactly what Capt. Justin Leake and his cousin encounter when December turns unseasonably warm. Its a grey morning with thick fog so Justin and Capt. Brent Berry wont be heading offshore right away as planned. Instead, Justin turns to his Humminbird CoastMaster charts to pinpoint a near shore artificial reef just five minutes from the St. Andrews Pass, where the anglers will do a little fishing until the fog burns off. Capt. Leake opts to send a jig to the bottom and hes not very picky about the one that gets tied on. When fishing reefs, the specific jig doesnt matter because its all about the presentation, he says. When youre sitting on top of a wreck, break out the junk jigs they get bit just fine. And that proves to be the case as Justin and Brent enjoy non-stop battles against amberjack, red snapper and bonita. And with a bite this good, theres no reason to go anywhere else! Also, we take a look at the United States Coast Guard Auxiliarys new paddle craft safety initiative.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: After several years of shifting focus back to his native whitetails, Dahlke returns to mule deer country with the Muley Freak, Erik Van Woerkom. Follow along on this Utah mule deer hunt.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest its about the journey.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Todd Rogers embraces the business of being a hunting outfitter as a labor of love. And while so many family-run operations are dwindling in rural America, the Rogers legacy is here to stay. Will Cooper and Josh Dahlke return to western Oklahoma to share this story while pursuing brush-country whitetails in the red dirt.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Ismael Garcia was just a young soldier when a tragic incident in Afghanistan changed his life forever. He was left wounded and scarred, but the hardest part came after he returned home. Hunting had always been his escape. But after war, everything felt different until he picked up a bow.

programme.desc: Renowned Kiteboarder Mike Walsh goes out on a windy day with Brandon to see what they can catch around the iconic lighthouses of the middle Keys.

programme.title: Life On The Water

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: On a crisp Iowa November morning, everything comes together as Drake Lamb with Midwest Whitetail grunts in a massive 8-point buck that he encountered before with the WoodHaven Midwest Grunter. This is one hunt you dont want to miss!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten & Mark Scroggins is in Oklahoma during the peak rut, chasing mature whitetail bucks! With bucks on the move and searching for does, it's the perfect time to break out the calls. Watch as Mark and Colten pull out all the stopsgetting aggressively loud with the WoodHaven "Intimidator" Grunt Callto turn a cruising buck and bring him right into bow range at the blind.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: U.S. Marines combat correspondent Ken Plant tells of being captured and tortured as a POW.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Bow season is finally here and the boys are at the Dirty Bird in Oklahoma. Randy is chasing a buck he named "The Camp Buck" because of how close the buck is to camp. If Randy can get it done this will be his biggest buck to date in Oklahoma.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are wrapping things up on the Raven before bow season arrives in Missouri. Planting I-70 the plot where Randy killed one of his biggest Missouri bucks ever last year. Then Randy and Cody attempt to setup a new farm they are calling The River Farm they attempt to plant a food plot, bush hog, spray the plot, setup a new Titan blind, and setup a Hooyman dual perimeter fence all in one day before the sun goes down.

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: Massive wildfires had consumed thousands of acres across the Bighorn Mountains and the neighboring foothills. Would the annual HuntStand pronghorn camp be a total bust, or would the crew be able to find a few animals beyond the smoke?

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Dan Schmidt struggles with freezing Nebraska temperatures on a whitetail rut hunt in the Sandhills.

programme.title: Pure Hunting
programme.desc: Willi and Chris have hunted NM for years with some success each year. This year they include two new friends, Nick Ventura and his dad. They receive rain like they never had before and when they finally make it out to hunt, Willi is hoping to connect.

programme.title: Pure Hunting
programme.desc: Willi spends 8 days chasing a few bucks, but has sights set on High Beam. After a few encounters and one on his last morning, he hopes for last minute success on his last afternoon.

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: October is here. We start out in Nebraska, head to Kansas and end up in Georgia. Many people have been impacted by the recent hurricanes. To help those in need we are hunting does and will donate as much venison as we possibly can to the victims.

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan and Michael Pitts try to keep the new season streak going. Things get real in a hurry when Pitts encounter doesnt go as planned.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Greg Camp heads back to Nebraska for the third year in a row hoping to put his bow tag on a giant 10 Pointer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer seasons past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson closes out the half way point on the South America Waterfowl Slam. On just the third day of the hunt, he is able to take a Chilean Wigeon and a Rosy Billed Pochard which make species number 9 and 10 of the 20 on his list. Mark is still sharing the blind with Matt Gindorff, a WTA consultant, and they discuss waterfowl hunting in Argentina and how it compares to that of the U.S.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed for the opportunity to follow along the guys from Trinity Oaks for Bucks for the Brave. The men and women that served in our armed services and as first responders, had jobs that required the, to be willing to sacrifice their own lives every day, in order to protect or save someone else's. Not many of us can say that, nor understand what that truly means. The things they've had to see, and the sacrifices they've made in their daily lives, can have a profound impact on them. Trinity Oaks' Bucks for the Brave platform allows the loved ones and communities that support these heroes to share their stories and unite us all in honoring and recognizing their service to our great nation. We are proud to continue to be a part of this incredible program, getting these heroes in the outdoors for the hunt of a lifetime.

programme.title: The Killing Fields

programme.title: 8 Seconds
programme.desc: Dreams and perseverance lead to an Oklahoma boy's meteoric rise as a champion bull rider in this film about the life of pro rodeo cowboy Lane Frost.

programme.title: Alien Autopsy
programme.desc: Two friends make a fake film that they claim is real footage of an autopsy conducted on an extraterrestrial.
